content.question: Which of the following developments in the period 1878â€“1922 best explains the change in Japanese trade patterns shown in the graphs above?

choices.label: Japanese manufacturing output decreased because Japanese leaders restricted commercial ties.
Export of manufactured goods declined because United States tariffs on Japanese goods increased.
Japanese manufacturing output rose as a consequence of industrialization.
Japanese imports of raw materials increased as a consequence of extensive immigration to Japan.

content.answer: Japanese manufacturing output rose as a consequence of industrialization.

skill.text: Skill 4.A: Identify and describe a historical context for a specific historical development or process.
